inner.name:
Insider
Threat
inner.description: Insider Threats refers to tools that are used to identify, block and remediate potential threats from trusted users or devices within a network.

inner.name: UEBA
inner.description: User and Entity Behaviour Analystics (UEBA) uses the behaviour of users to understand and predict potential threats to the network.

inner.name: Digital Rights Management
inner.description: Digital Rights Management (DRM) secures sensitive data through its entire life cycle, everywhere it travels, no matter who has it or where it’s stored.

inner.name: File Integrity Monitoring
inner.description: File Integrity Monitoring reduces risk with security monitoring and change detection, for visibility into changes on your network and risk remediation

inner.name: Zero Trust/ZTNA
inner.description: Zero Trust is an infosec model that is based on providing strict access controls and not trusting anyone by default, even those already inside the network perimeter.

inner.name: Threat Hunting
inner.description: Threat Hunting is a more proactive approach, assuming a network or infrastructure has potentially been compromised and looking for hidden malware or bad actors.

inner.name:
Threat
Removal
inner.description: Threat Removal is a proactive, detection-based approach that intercepts data on its way to its destination, and re-builds it securely.

inner.name: SOAR
inner.description: SOAR (Security orchestration, automation, and response) delivers faster response times, with streamlined and automated incident response workflows.

inner.name: Red Teaming
inner.description: Threat emulation tools mimick an advanced, stealthy threat actor that’s been embedded in an IT environment for running Adversary Simulations.

inner.name: Attack Surface Management
inner.description: Attack surface management (ASM) is the continuous discovery, analysis, remediation and monitoring of the cybersecurity vulnerabilities and potential attack vectors that make up an organisation's attack surface.

inner.name: Container Security
inner.description: Container security implements and manages security tools and policies to provide protection within any container (such as for Docker or Kubernetes)

inner.name: Browser Isolation / RBI
inner.description: Remote Browser Isolation (RBI) uses a Zero Trust approach to browsing, run the session in the cloud away from your networks and endpoints, insulating devices and the user from attacks.

inner.name: Digital Risk Protection
inner.description: Digital Risk Protection provides external cybersecurity, encompasses threat intelligence, protection and response solutions with visibility and protection beyond the network perimeter across the surface, deep and dark web

inner.name: DevSecOps
inner.description: DevSecOps helps automate and integrate infosecurity into every stage of the application development lifecycle.

inner.name: Application Security
inner.description: Application Security secures code moving through the entire application development pipeline and continuously protect applications across the complete software lifecycle

middle.name: EDR
middle.description: EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response) proactively monitors the network and endpoints for threats, and includes analytics and event correlation capabilities to improve response speeds.

middle.name:
Data
Classification
middle.description: Data Classification organises and tags data anywhere on a network, for more efficient profiling and protection by security tools.

middle.name: MDR
middle.description: MDR (Managed Detection and Response) takes EDR and provides it as a managed service, utilising a team of analysts in a SOC to hutn for potential threats and respond in realtime.

middle.name: Secure File Transfer
middle.description: Secure File Transfer helps protect data and files in transit, using encryption, authentication and automation to maximise security and meet compliance requirements.

middle.name: XDR
middle.description: Extended Detection and Response (XDR) is a consolidation of tools and data that provides extended visibility, analysis, and response across endpoints, workloads, users, and networks.

middle.name: Private Access
middle.description: Private Access provides secure access to private cloud or legacy network applications without the need for a VPN.

middle.name: DDos
middle.description: A Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attack occurs when multiple devices or systems make an internet-facing resource unavailable through a flood of connections.

middle.name: SASE
middle.description: Secure Access Service Edge (SASE)  is a cloud-based model that combines software-defined networking with network security functions and delivers them from a single service provider.

middle.name: ATP
middle.description: ATP (Advanced Threat Protection) is designed to defend against unknown threats, complimenting traditional security, often using ML and AI techniques.

middle.name: Auditing
middle.description: A cybersecurity audit involves a comprehensive analysis and review of an IT infrastructure. It detects vulnerabilities and threats, displaying weak links and high-risk practices.

middle.name:
Breach and Attack
Simulation
middle.description: Breach Simulation is designed to automate and continuously validate cybersecurity defences and controls across the kill chain, especially against new threats and techniques.

middle.name: DNS Security
middle.description: DNS (Domain Name System) security provides visibility of all network traffic, helping spots threats quicker and locking down networks in the event of an attack.

middle.name:
Privileged
Access
Management
middle.description: Privileged access management (PAM) is an identity security solution that helps protect organisations against cyberthreats by monitoring, detecting, and preventing unauthorised privileged access to critical resources.

middle.name: SIEM
middle.description: SIEM (Security Incident and Event Management) combines  information and security event management, co-ordinating and analysing data from multiple sources.

middle.name: Policy Automation
middle.description:
Security Policy Automation allows visibility and control over all on-premises and cloud perimeter assets,
by deploying security policies consistently across all infrastructure to allow easier management and auditing.

middle.name: Threat Intelligence
middle.description: Threat Intelligence helps feed into and compliment existing technologies, with third-party insights to more quickly identify new threats, trends and exploits.

middle.name: Workload Protection
middle.description: Cloud workload protection is the protection and best practice security protocols placed around your cloud workloads (such as entail files, containers, functions, nodes, etc.)

middle.name: Cloud Policy Orchestration
middle.description: Cloud orchestration helps manage all connections and interactions on public and private cloud infrastructure, automating tasks, reporting and policy enforcement.

middle.name: BOT Management
middle.description: Bot management involves identifying and blocking some bots from a website or application, while still allowing access to other bots that are legitmate or authorised.

middle.name: CNAPP
middle.description: CNAPP (Cloud Native Application Protection) provides security across the application lifecycle, encompassing features such as scanning, runtime protection and checking for misconfiguration.

middle.name: ITDR
middle.description: ITDR (Identity Threat Detection and Response) continuously validates to prevent network takeovers, focusing on identity repositories (like Active Directory) to prevent misconfigurations and detects attacks in real-time

middle.name: WAF
middle.description: A Web Application Firewall (WAF) helps protect websites and web applications against attacks, exploits and threats.

middle.name: SSO
middle.description: Single Sign On (SSO) alows a user to sign on once, but syndicates access to multiple systems or applications.

outer.name: Anti-Virus/Malware
outer.description: Anti-Virus or Anti-Malware helps protect endpoints against attacks or compromise by malicious software.

outer.name: Security Education
outer.description: Security Education provides training, knowledge-transfer, simulations and content for on-going employee traing and awareness.

outer.name: Encryption
outer.description: Encryption helps secure data-at-rest, by encrypting data for endpoints against physical device post-theft data exfiltration.

outer.name:
Mobile
Security
outer.description: Mobile Security encompasses endpoint security for mobile and tablet devices, both the OS (such as iOS/Android) and apps.

outer.name:
DLP/
Data Security
outer.description: DLP (Data Loss Prevention) helps organises identify, track and secure confidential data to protect it from leaving, either through accidental or deliberate loss.

outer.name: VPN
outer.description: Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) help users and devices connect securely to remote networks.

outer.name:
Network
Firewall
outer.description: A network firewall is a gateway device that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic, with defined rules and policies to prevent unauthorised access to a network.

outer.name: Web Security
outer.description: Web security provides protection for any users or devices accessing public web applications or services.

outer.name: Email Security
outer.description: Email Security provides protection and security for email gateways or applications.

outer.name: Phishing Protection
outer.description: Phishing protection detects and defends against potential phishing attacks through email gateways.

outer.name: Automated Pen Testing
outer.description: Pen / Penetration Testing is a service to simulate a cyberattack on a network, application or infrastructure, to identify potential vulnerabilities or gaps in the defences.

outer.name: IPS
outer.description: IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) is part of network security that works to detect and prevent identified threats, primarily through the gateway.

outer.name: Identity Access Management
outer.description: ARM helps control and manage access to applications, data and networks by internal staff and external individuals and organisations.

outer.name: DMARC
outer.description: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC) enables a domain owner to protect the domain against unauthorised use.

outer.name: SD-WAN
outer.description: SD-WAN provides software-defined networking, delivering improvements in performance and management.

outer.name: CAS/CASB
outer.description: Cloud Application Security (CAS) or Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) acts as security service between users and a cloud application, to enforce security policies.

outer.name:
Cloud
Security
outer.description: Cloud Security provides cloud-native security for applications, workloads and infrastructure for public, private and multi-cloud environments.

outer.name:
Virtual
Patching
outer.description: Virtual Patching applies short protection to an existing exploit, where a patch may not be available or able to be deployed.

outer.name:
Patch
Management
outer.description: Patch Management helps automate the application of patches for the operating systems and applications across the network, cloud and endpoints.

outer.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
outer.description: Multi Factor Authentication helps validate identity for access to an application or data via something you know, have or are.

outer.name: Applications Security
outer.description: Application Control provides managed access and rights for users to run applications on their network or corporate devices.

outer.name: Vulnerability Remediation
outer.description: Vulnerability remediation helsp an organisation efficiently find and fix potential threats across it's network.
